arts.ttl: Germany vs Luxembourg – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: Germany host Luxembourg in a crucial FIFA World Cup qualifier on Friday evening as Julian Nagelsmann’s side looks to bounce back from their underwhelming start to the World Cup qualifying campaign. Germany vs Luxembourg – Match Preview and Team News Date: 10th October, Friday. Kick-off: 7:45pm BST. Venue: PreZero Arena, Sinsheim. Julian Nagelsmann’s team are aiming to recover from a less-than-impressive start to their qualifying campaign. arts.ttl: Germany vs. Luxembourg preview: Team news and predicted lineups
arts.sum: Germany face a crucial test on Friday, when they take on Luxembourg in Sinsheim in their third qualifier for the 2026 FIFA World Cup. After a mixed start to the campaign, Julian Nagelsmann’s side know that only a win will keep their qualification hopes firmly on track.

arts.ttl: Julian Nagelsmann admits Germany are ‘in no position to underestimate an opponent’ ahead of Luxembourg
arts.sum: Knowing full well that his job and country's World Cup prospects are on the line, Bundestrainer Julian Nagelsmann wished to make clear on Thursday that he would not be taking upcoming opponent Luxembourg lightly.

arts.ttl: Woltemade returns to full training ahead of Germany's clash with Luxembourg
arts.sum: Nick Woltemade is available for Germany's upcoming match against Luxembourg after recovering from illness.
